data.event: The population was 1,482 at the time of the year 2000 U.S. census.
William Brown founed the city in 1837 as Brown's Landing, but the post office established the next year took the name Livermore.
William Brown founed the city in 1837 as Brown's Landing, but the post office established the next year took the name Livermore.

event.title: was formally incorporated by the state assembly in 1850

data.event: The city was formally incorporated by the state assembly in 1850.

event.title: April 20, 1911, a black man named Will Porter (or Potter) shot and wounded

data.event: On April 20, 1911, a black man named Will Porter (or Potter) shot and wounded Frank Mitchell, a white man, after a barroom argument.
